intro: Lampranthus arenosus, commonly known as the sand lampranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. This species thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators. Lampranthus arenosus is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
